document_data.caption2: Various depictions of tomes of leadership and influence.
document_data.name: Tome of Leadership and Influence
document_data.othernames: ''How to Win Friends and Influence People''
document_data.mainbody: '''''Tomes of leadership and influence''''',  sometimes titled '''''How to Win Friends and Influence People''''', were valuable enchanted tomes that collected philosophies and guides of self-improvement and possessed potent magics that could permanently argument the reader's charisma.
document_data.Description: These rare enchanted tomes with cynical names These manuals guided their readers on a path of personal ascendancy, teaching them skills of social manipulation. The authors of these self-help publications claimed that the contents of these manuals were sourced from the most recent developments in the fields of sociology and interpersonal psychology.
document_data.Powers:
The writings of ''tomes of leadership and influence'' were weaved with spells and magics that, upon the investment of time studying the text (at least forty-eight hours over at least six days), magically improved the reader's charisma. The same enchantments caused these books to disintegrate into dust once their magic was used. Some books, however, after being depleted of their magic, turned mundane, avoiding disintegration.

Some versions of ''Tomes of leadership and influence'' granted its reader the boon of experience.
document_data.Creation: A ''tomes of leadership and influence'' could be created by an experienced crafter of wondrous items via the use of ''[[miracle]]'' or ''[[wish]]'' spells.
document_data.History:
Some considered the self-destruction of ''tomes of leadership and influence'' to be an excellent marketing strategy.

A copy of ''How to Win Friends and Influence People'' was held in the upper floor libraries of [[Castle Maluradek]] in the desserts of [[Anauroch]] ''circa'' [[1281 DR]].

''Circa'' [[1368 DR]], one such book could be found inside one of the several cave tombs underneath the [[gnoll]]-occupied citadel to the south of [[Baldur's Gate]] and west of [[Nashkel]].
